info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 6:14PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Mesa and Grand Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...expect minor low-land flooding between the confluence with the Gunnison River and the CO-UT State Line, including inundated sections of the Riverside Front Trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 13.6 feet late Sunday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Colorado River CO-UT State Lin 15.0 12.3 Wed 5 pm MDT 12.6 13.0 13.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
